data.title: University of North Texas
data.meta_description: Michael Miller (23) Guard - 2018-19 • Played in all 33 games and started 24 • North Texas' most improved player increasing his scoring average up 7.1 points ...
data.text:
2018-19

• Played in all 33 games and started 24

• North Texas' most improved player increasing his scoring average up 7.1 points per game and his rebound average up 3.3 rebounds per game from the previous season

• Scored the game-winning layup on Dec. 8 versus UT Arlington and then again on Jan. 19 versus Rice

• Was third on the team in scoring at 10.4 points per game (343)

• Scored a career-high 35 points against Arkansas Pine Bluff on Dec. 20

• Recorded a double-double on Feb. 9 versus WKU with 14 points and 11 rebounds

• Had a career-high 13 rebounds on Feb. 7 versus Marshall

• Scored in double figures 17 times

• Scored 15 or more points eight times

• Played through a broken foot in the conference tournament and still grabbed 10 rebounds in the Mean Green's first round win over FIU

• Made a career-high six three-pointers on Dec. 20 versus Arkansas Pine Bluff

• Had the second-most offensive rebounds on the team with 69

• Second on the team in blocks with 16

• Played all 40 minutes on Feb. 16 at FIU

• Started the final 24 games

2017-18

• Played in 30 games

• Averaged 3.6 points and 2.5 rebounds per game for the season

• Started all six CBI Tournament games, averaging 10.3 points per game and 5.7 rebounds

• Switched to shooting right-handed against South Dakota in the CBI first round and scored a career-high 19 points off 4-for-5 from the three-point line

• Hit eight three-pointers in the CBI Tournament run and finished with three double-digit performances

• Scored 12 points in the CBI Championship game three against San Francisco

• Scored seven points in his Mean Green debut against Bethune-Cookman

• Also finished with seven points against McNeese

• Appeared in 12 Conference USA games, scoring four points twice

• Grabbed five rebounds twice against Bethune-Cookman and at Rice

Shawnee Community College

• Played two seasons at Shawnee Community College

• Averaged 14.3 points per game in 2016-17

• Posted three double-doubles on the season and averaged six rebounds per game as a guard

• Was ranked No. 33 among the top 100 JUCO players in the nation in 2017, according to JUCOrecruiting.com

• Miller was named an honorable mention on the 2016-17 NJCAA All-America teams

High School Highlights

• Averaged 10.4 points, 4.7 rebounds, 2.7 assists and 1.3 steals per game as a senior at Michigan City High School
